sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: Computes the floor of an n-dimensional array elementwise. The floor of a number is defined as the smallest integer that is less than or equal to that number. The general syntax for its use is y = floor(x) where x is a multidimensional array of numerical type. The floor function preserves the type of the argument. So integer arguments are not modified, and float arrays return float arrays as outputs, and similarly for double arrays. The floor function is not defined for complex types.

sect1.title: Example
